alert.note: Alert for Anoka (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 10:21AM CDT until May 21 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Rum River near St. Francis affecting Anoka County. .Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant rises in area rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rum River near St. Francis. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 AM CDT Tuesday, the stage was 8.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 930 AM CDT Tuesday was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 06/08/2014. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
